newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT-Newmont Mining estimates up.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Newmont Mining estimates up.

text.p: -- Everen Securities analyst Todd Hinrichs said Friday he had raised his earnings estimates for Newmont Mining Corp to $1.28 a share from $0.91 for 1997, to $1.50 frm $1.00 for 1998, to $1.84 from $0.97 for 1999, and to $1.95 from $1.09 for 2000.
-- Newmont Mining is the majority holder of Newmont Gold Co.
-- In a report, Hinrichs said estimates were raised to reflect the company's increased interest in Yanacocha, a Peruvian mine, as well as recent discussions with management.
-- Newmont Mining shares were down 1/2 at 44-1/2.
-- Newmont Gold shares were off 3/4 at 45-3/8.

-- The analyst said he continues to anticipate the company's earnings will show strength through the end of the decade due to increased interest in Yanacocha, as well as slightly lower costs and greater future production from the Minahasa mine in Indonesia, eventual start-up of the La Herradura mine in Mexico, commencement of production from the Batu Hijau project in Indonesia, and the potential to add production from its High Desert venture near the end of the decade.
